page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: RELIGION - The Church of St.James, Brassington is built of stone. The tower, with its unique feature of two buttresses on the South side, parts of the porch and the South aisle are all Norman; so it the font. Inside the West wall of the tower is "the oldest inhabitant"of Brassington; this is a stone about 30x20cms., built into the wall, on which is carved in high relief the 3/4 naked figure of a man with his hand on his heart. This is thought to be older than the tower itself. Marble from Ashford-in-the-Water was used for the column of the Arches between the nave and the new North aisle which was added in the 19th Century. The chancel, parts of which are decorated 14th century work, was lengthened.
